page.title: 03GEOLOGY OF THE AREA
page.content: The{bedrock}of the area is {Triassic Bunter Sandstone}which forms a soft pale red-brown fine to medium sandstone.In the west of the area the sandstone forms a range of hills with a north to south trend,but nowhere does it appear at the surface. The reason for this is that the area is covered by{Quaternary deposits to a depth of about 10m.The western range of hills are covered in{boulder {clay}which consists mainly of stiff grey clayey till deposited from beneath the ice sheets.The rest of the area is covered in{gravel beds and {pebble-free sands}derived from the south in the Trent valley.It is thought they were deposited in a{lake which covered the area as the ice sheets receeded.
